main.name: Nick Kwok
main.occupation: Full Stack Developer that has spent the last decade in the non-profit world, the last five of those years serving as a managing director
main.description: I bring an undying passion for coding, a conviction for excellence, an unending desire to learn and a heart to coach, train and empower others
main.bio: I love to code. I have built a handful of projects using HTML, CSS, Javascript, jQuery, Boostrap, PHP and MySQL. The stack I currently am enjoying the most is using React, Node.js and either NoSQL database langauges like MongoDB and Firebase or an RDBMS like PostgreSQL and MySQL. I'm also an avid woodworker! I stumbled into a passion for woodworking when my neighbors were throwing out a pottery barn dining table and asked if I wanted it. Having zero clue what I was doing, I refinished the table and have not been able to stop restoring and building furniture since. I love the craft of building something tangible and figuring out the best way to build something - quite similar to how I feel about coding!
main.contactmessage: Wanna talk tech, woodworking and/or collaborate on a future project? Drop me a message and lets connect!

resume.skillmessage: Here are the skills, languages and technologies I have learned to use in my time as a Full Stack Developer

education.description: 32+ hour of effective business communication, writing, conflict management and leadership curriculum.

education.degree: Bachelors of Science - Business Information and Decision Systems
education.description: As an IDS major, I took several technical courses: (IDS 306 & 406) - Data and Systems Analysis/Design (IDS 315) - Visual Basic (IDS 380) - Data Management - MySQL, PHP (IDS 460) - Project Management (IDS 481) - E-Business and Web Dev (HTML/CSS, PHP, MySQL) (IDS 492) - Managing/Deploying Information Systems

work.title: Full Stack Developer - Intern
work.description: Silver City Uprising is a non-profit organization that is building an online platform that provides mentoring and career development to under-resourced youth in hope of decreasing youth involvement with gang activity and increasing community involvement. We are building this platform with a PERN Stack.
work.contributions: Built and styled several React Components for member's portal UI to improve UX.Built back-end API that allows members to access the core features of SCU's portal. Currently helping to integrate Prisma into our API.

work.title: WordPress Engineer
work.description: The Roof Tiger is a roofing & siding business in Illinois that focuses on loving people, families and their homes.
work.contributions: Designed, built and deployed a website for The Roof Tiger with WordPress and helped them collect customer contact info in one week. I used Elementor to build, setup their contact database with WPForms and setup them up for eCommerce using WooCommerce. See my portfolio for original design prior to their changes.

work.title: Greater Los Angeles Managing Director
work.description: Greek IV is a non-profit orgazniation that holistically develops Fraternity and Sorority students in their leadership development and spiritual growth.
work.contributions: In my time serving with Greek IV, I helped to expand Greek IV to 7 new campuses impacting ~250 students per year. I have hired, created and executed trainings for 15 intern & staff. I have recruited and developed over 50 key leaders in movement. I have raised over $715k in donations over the span of 10 years. I have organized and ran operations for 2 annual conferences serving ~150 students.

work.title: Regional Director (IL, IN, WI, MI)
work.description: Sigma Phi Epsilon (SigEp) is a non-profit National Fraternity that complement's the educational experience for fraternity men by delivering premier student experiences. SigEp helps to strengthen character, build leadership and interpersonal skills and learn to develop healthy, lifelong relationships that are essential to a successful and fulfilling life.
work.contributions: As a Regional Director, I oversaw the growth, development and fiscal health of 23 SigEp chapters across 4 states by influencing chapter leadership and cultivating partnership with alumni and university staff. I was a 2x John C. Henry recipient for highest performing Region for of the 4 quarters.

work.title: IT Project Management Intern
work.description: I was accepted into AT&T IT Internship Program where I served alongside a team of developers, testers and project managers.
work.contributions: As an IT Project Management Intern, I assisted three different IT Project Managers in performing audts, impact assessments and performing data migrations. I was two of 8 interns asked to return and received a job offer to become a Junior IT Project Manager.
